remixlab.fpstiming

Class TimingHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.fpstiming.TimingHandler

  • public class TimingHandler
extends Object
    A timing handler holds a timerPool() and an animatorPool(). The timer pool are all the tasks scheduled to be performed in the future (one single time or periodically). The animation pool are all the objects that implement an animation callback function. For an introduction to FPSTiming please refer to this.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle()
        Handler's main method. It should be called from within your main event loop. It does the following: 1. Recomputes the frame rate; 2. Executes the all timers (those in the timerPool()) callback functions; and, 3. Performs all the animated objects (those in the animatorPool()) animation functions.

      • timerPool

        public ArrayList<TimingTask> timerPool()
        Returns the timer pool.

      • registerTask

        public void registerTask(TimingTask task)
        Register a task in the timer pool and creates a sequential timer for it.

      • registerTask

        public void registerTask(TimingTask task,
                Timer timer)
        Register a task in the timer pool with the given timer.

      • unregisterTask

        public void unregisterTask(SeqTimer t)
        Unregisters the timer. You may also unregister the task this timer is attached to.
        See Also:
        unregisterTask(TimingTask)

      • unregisterTask

        public void unregisterTask(TimingTask task)
        Unregisters the timer task.
        See Also:
        unregisterTask(SeqTimer)

      • isTaskRegistered

        public boolean isTaskRegistered(TimingTask task)
        Returns true if the task is registered and false otherwise.

      • frameRate

        public float frameRate()
        Returns the approximate frame rate of the software as it executes. The initial value is 10 fps and is updated with each frame. The value is averaged (integrated) over several frames. As such, this value won't be valid until after 5-10 frames.

      • frameCount

        public long frameCount()
        Returns the number of frames displayed since the program started.

      • restoreTimers

        public void restoreTimers()
        Converts all registered timers to single-threaded timers.

      • animatorPool

        public ArrayList<Animator> animatorPool()
        Returns all the animated objects registered at the handler.
